stepAnswer: null: μ1 $$=$$ μ2 alternate: μ1 ≠ μ2
stepTitle: Two metal alloys are being considered as material for ball bearings. The mean melting point of the two alloys is to be compared. $$15$$ pieces of each metal are being tested. Both populations have normal distributions. The following table is the result. It is believed that Alloy Zeta has a different melting point. What is the null and alternate hypotheses?
answerLatex: null: μ1 $$=$$ μ2 alternate: μ1 ≠ μ2
choices: null: μ1 $$=$$ μ2 alternate: μ1 ≠ μ2
null: μ1 $$=$$ μ2 alternate: μ1 $$=$$ μ2
null: μ1 ≠ μ2 alternate: μ1 $$=$$ μ2
null: μ1 ≠ μ2 alternate: μ1 ≠ μ2
